about-me.description:
Hi, I'm Demis. I'm passionate about software development because I love the mix of creativity and logical thinking. Every project is a new opportunity to turn complex problems into clear and efficient solutions. My inspiration comes from constantly learning and refining my code to make it more elegant step by step. 

 Let's bring ideas to life and create something remarkable together!
about-me.title: About me

skills.title: Skill set
skills.description: I am passionate about building modern and responsive web applications. My focus is on creating clean, efficient, and user-friendly interfaces. I continuously explore new tools and frameworks to expand my skill set.
skills.react-and-vue:
Also, I'm interested
in diving into:

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Explore my projects! They're built to be responsive, user-friendly, and powered by clean, efficient code for smooth performance on any device.
projects.join: Task manager inspired by the Kanban System. Create and organize tasks using drag and drop functions, assign users and categories.
projects.el-pollo-loco: Jump, run and throw game based on object-oriented approach. Help Pepe to find coins and tabasco salsa to fight against the crazy hen.
projects.pokedex: This app is a Pokédex - a digital encyclopedia from the Pokémon universe that provides detailed information about different Pokémon, including their abilities, types, and evolutions.

first-card.comment: Demis really kept the team together with his great organization and clear communication. We wouldn't have got this far without his commitment.
first-card.author: Tobias Lange

second-card.comment: It was a great pleasure to work with Demis. He knows how to push and encourage team members to present the best work possible, always adding something to brainstorm.
second-card.author: Maria Schäfer

third-card.comment: Demis was a top team colleague at DA. His positive commitment and willingness to take on responsibility made a significant contribution to us achieving our goals.
third-card.author: David Braun
